content: Which of the following statements best describes the influence of market immigration on the German economy?

answers.text: a) The German economy is dominated by the increasing number of small companies.
b) The German economy is dominated by the increasing number of large multinational companies.
c) The German economy is dominated by the increasing number of local companies.
d) The German economy is dominated by the increasing number of international companies.

content: What is the main difference between "Customer Centric" and "Value-Based" Marketing?

answers.text: a) Customer-Centric Marketing focuses on customer satisfaction, while value-based marketing focuses on added value for the customer.
b) Customer-Centric Marketing focuses on customer loyalty, while value-based marketing focuses on customer acquisition.
c) Customer-Centric Marketing focuses on customer loyalty, while value-based marketing focuses on customer acquisition.
d) Customer-Centric Marketing focuses on added value for the customer, while value-based marketing focuses on customer satisfaction.

content: Which of the following marketing strategies is most effective to establish a brand in a new market?

answers.text: a) An intensive local advertising with a focus on regional products.
b) a global marketing campaign with a uniform message.
c) A gradual introduction of the product and a local adjustment of the marketing strategy.
d) a quick creation of a large advertising campaign.

content: What does "Dark Social" mean in the context of social media?

answers.text: a) Social media posts that are created and shared by the users themselves.
b) Social media posts that are created and shared by companies.
c) Social media posts that are shared by external influencers.
d) Social media posts that customers create and shared by customers themselves.

content: Which of the following statements best describes the meaning of data analysis in marketing?

answers.text: a) Data analysis is only relevant for large companies.
b) Data analysis is crucial to better understand customer needs and optimize marketing campaigns.
c) Data analysis is unnecessary for marketing activities.
d) Data analysis is only for the creation of advertisements.

content: What is the difference between "branding" and "marketing"?

answers.text: a) Branding is part of marketing while marketing is the goal.
b) Branding is the process of creating a brand identity, while marketing is the implementation of this identity.
c) Branding is a slow process while marketing is fast.
d) Branding is a complicated process while marketing is simple.

content: Which of the following strategies is best suited to increase customer loyalty?

answers.text: a) offer constant price reductions.
b) Obtain the customer feedback and respond to his needs.
c) offer a large selection of products.
d) Reduce customer loyalty by increasing the costs to the customer.
a) Marketing, where companies interact directly with customers.
b) Marketing, in which influencers advertise products or services.
c) Marketing, in which companies spread their products via social media.
d) Marketing, in which customers advertise products.

content: Which of the following statements best describes the role of digital transformation in marketing?

answers.text: a) Digital transformation is the reduction in the customer base.
b) Digital transformation includes the integration of digital technologies in all marketing activities.
c) Digital transformation is the loss of the customer base.
d) Digital transformation is the loss of customers.
a) A method of convincing customers to buy a product.
b) a method of testing different versions of a website or a marketing campaign to find out which works best.
c) a method of encouraging customers to register a newsletter.
d) a method of reducing the costs of a marketing campaign.
